transportAdvice: Luxor's main tourist sites are spread across the east and west banks of the Nile, making walking practical only within each bank's central areas; taxis and horse-drawn carriages are widely available for longer distances, and local minibuses serve residents but are less convenient for tourists navigating between major sites.

weather.description: Cool, dry, and sunny with chilly nights — the most comfortable month for sightseeing.
Warm days and mild nights make this an excellent time to explore outdoor temples and tombs.
Temperatures rise noticeably but remain manageable, with occasional dusty winds beginning to appear.
Getting hot, with the risk of khamsin dust storms; early morning visits to sites are strongly advisable.
Intense heat sets in and outdoor activity should be limited to early mornings and evenings.
Extremely hot and dry — one of the most challenging months for travel, with midday temperatures often exceeding 40°C.
Peak summer heat continues; shade and hydration are essential, and tourist crowds are at their thinnest.
Conditions remain brutally hot with virtually no rainfall; travel is possible but demanding.
Slight cooling begins toward the end of the month, though heat remains significant throughout.
Pleasantly warm and dry with comfortable evenings — a popular month for visitors returning to the sites.
Ideal sightseeing weather with warm days, cool nights, and clear skies across the Nile Valley.
Cool and sunny with cold nights — pack layers for evenings and early morning temple visits.
